ray.rage.scene.generic

Class GenericEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.AbstractGenericSceneObject
      • ray.rage.scene.generic.GenericEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Visible, Entity, SceneObject

    final class GenericEntity
extends AbstractGenericSceneObject
implements Entity
    A generic implementation of the Entity interface.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericEntity

        GenericEntity(SceneManager manager,
              java.lang.String name,
              Mesh m)
        Creates a new entity with the given parent manager, name, and mesh.
        Parameters:
        manager - The parent manager.
        name - The name for this entity.
        m - The mesh this entity is based on.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name is empty.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the mesh has no sub-meshes.

      • setMaterial

        public void setMaterial(Material mat)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        A convenience method that sets the same material to all its sub-entities.

        Only use this method if you want all the sub-entities of this entity to use the same material or if you're certain there's only one material to be used.

        If more granularity is needed, then use Entity.getSubEntity(int) to retrieve and update individual sub-entities.

        Specified by:
        setMaterial in interface Entity
        Parameters:
        mat - The material to be set for each sub-entity.

      • setGpuShaderProgram

        public void setGpuShaderProgram(GpuShaderProgram prog)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        A convenience method that sets the shader-program that should be used to render the sub-entities of this entity.

        Only use this method if you want all the sub-entities of this entity to use the same shader-program.

        If more granularity is needed, then use Entity.getSubEntity(int) to retrieve and update individual sub-entities.

        Specified by:
        setGpuShaderProgram in interface Entity
        Parameters:
        prog - The shader-program to use.

      • setPrimitive

        public void setPrimitive(Renderable.Primitive prim)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        A convenience method that sets the same primitive for all its sub-entities.

        Only use this method if you want all the sub-entities of this entity to use the same primitive.

        If more granularity is needed, then use Entity.getSubEntity(int) to retrieve and update individual sub-entities.

        Specified by:
        setPrimitive in interface Entity
        Parameters:
        prim - The primitive to be set for each sub-entity.

      • visitSubEntities

        public void visitSubEntities(SubEntity.Visitor visitor)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        A convenience method that allows a SubEntity.Visitor to visit all the sub-entities of this entity.
        Specified by:
        visitSubEntities in interface Entity
        Parameters:
        visitor - The SubEntity.Visitor.

      • setRenderState

        public void setRenderState(RenderState rs)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        A convenience method that sets the same render-state for all its sub-entities.

        Only use this method if you want all the sub-entities of this entity to use the same render-state.

        If more granularity is needed, then use Entity.getSubEntity(int) to retrieve and update individual sub-entities.

        Specified by:
        setRenderState in interface Entity
        Parameters:
        rs - The render-state to be set for each sub-entity.

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractGenericSceneObject
